task.title: Launch a New Instance
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you create a new instance.

task.title: Select an Image
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to select a base image to use for creating your instance.

step.cmd: There are two ways to specify a base image:

ul.li: Type an image name directly into the Enter an image ID text box

Select an image from the list of images on the panel. You can filter the list of images by typing some filter text into the search textbox, or by selected one or more filters in the Filter by section to the left of the image list.

step.cmd: Click the Next button to proceed to the Details panel.

task.title: Details
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify the names, tags, instance size, number of instances, and the availability zone of your new instance(s).

step.cmd: Enter the number of new instances to create in the Number of instances text box.
You can optionally enter one or more names for your new instance(s) in the Instance name(s) text box(es).
Select an instance size from the Instance size drop-down list box.

info.note: Information about the instance size is displayed when you click the instance size link.

step.cmd: If you want to specify an availability zone other than the default, select an availability zone using the Availability zone drop-down list box.

info.note: The availability zone does not apply if you choose a VPC network for your security settings in the proceeding panel.

step.cmd: To help you manage your cloud's instances, images, and other Eucalyptus resources, you can optionally assign your own metadata to each resource in the form of tags. You can use tags to create user-friendly names, make resource searching easier, and improve coordination between multiple users. To add tags to this resource:

substep.cmd: Type the key name for your tag into the name... text box.
Type the value for your tag into the value... text box.
To add this tag, click the Add Tag button.
If you wish to delete a tag that you've already entered, click the x button to the right of the tag.

step.cmd: Click the Next button to proceed to the Security panel.

task.title: Security
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network, key pair and security group that will be used by your new instance(s). NOTE: if you create a key pair or security group in this section, they will automatically be selected for use in your new instance.

step.cmd: Select a VPC network from the drop-down list box.
step.stepresult: If a VPC network is selected, the VPC subnet and the Auto-assign public IP drop-down list boxes display.

step.cmd: Select a CIDR range from the VPC subnet drop-down list box.
Select whether to enable or disable public IP auto assignment from the Auto-assign public IP drop-down list box.
Select a key pair using the Key name drop-down list box.

info.note: You can also create a new key pair by clicking the Create a key pair link.

step.cmd: Select a security group using the Security group drop-down list box.

info.note: If you select the default security group, make sure that you've added rules to the default security group so that you can access your instances.
You can also create a new security group by clicking the Create a security group link. This opens the Create Security Group dialog box.

step.stepresult: If one of the existing security groups is chosen, the rules associated with the security group display.

step.cmd: You can optionally specify an IAM role using the Role drop-down list box.

info.note: If you select a role, make sure that the correct permissions are defined for that role so that the appropriate level of access is applied to your instance.

step.cmd: You can optionally specify advanced options by clicking the Select advanced options link and refer to the next section for further details.
Click the Launch instance(s) button.

task.title: Specify Advanced Options
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify advanced options for your new instance(s). You can add user data, override the kernel and RAM disk IDs, specify private networking, and add additional storage.

step.cmd: Specify custom user data by typing it into the User data text box or by attaching a file by selecting Upload file then clicking the Choose File... button to browse for the file.
You can override the kernel ID in the selected image with the Kernel ID drop-down list box.
You can override the RAM disk ID in the selected image with the RAM disk ID (RAMFS) drop-down list box.
Click the Enable monitoring check box to specify that detailed CloudWatch metric gathering should be enabled for your new instance(s).

Click the Use private addressing only check box to specify that your new instance should use private addressing only. Private addresses cannot connect directly to the Internet and must go through a NAT (Network Address Translation) device or an elastic IP address mapped to the instance.
The Storage section will only display if you have an EBS-backed image. If this is the case, you can configure additional storage for your instance:

substep.cmd: Select a volume type using the Volume drop-down list box.
Type the desired mapping for the storage into the Mapping text box (for example: /dev/sdb).
If you want to create the storage from an existing snapshot, specify it in the Create from snapshot drop-down list box.
Type the size of the attached storage in gigabytes into the Size (GB) text box.
Select the Delete on termination check box if you would like the attached storage to be deleted when the instance is terminated.
Click the Add device button to add this storage.
You can delete storage you've already added by clicking the minus button on the right side of the storage list item.

step.cmd: Click the Launch Instance button to launch your new instance(s).
